body:
Hi...
> In the introduction, you should indicate that HDR means High Dynamic Range - you use both, but don't equate them.  I've spoken to several photographers who think HDR is a look, and have no idea that it might mean something else.
I am not sure if it would discourage the targetted audience - but maybe 
one should just write that HDR, which means High Dynamic Range - is not 
really suitable as a format to share for web browser display.


And than go on explaining how to create "good" tone-mapped images.


I do not know anyone who really browses the net for hdr-images. 
Everything seams to be about tone-mapped images.


CU Lars.
